channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mattress, bed frame and furniture, 6th September
item.description:
Beside the recycling bins between Tomson and Attilburgh House SE1 3DL. This mattress, bed frame, clothes dryer and side table plus other detritus have been here for about a week, now. Southwark's last communication stated that you were making regular inspections for flytipping, but this doesn't appear to have worked, hence this report. Please could you remove these items.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riley Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defective Manhole, 6th September
item.description:
I am writing to report a defective manhole cover located on Clapham High Street. Each time a vehicle passes over the cover it produces a loud metallic bang akin to a gun‑shot. The noise is frequent—particularly during the night—and has become a significant disturbance; I am unable to open my windows and my sleep is severely affected. In addition to the noise nuisance, the rocking cover poses a potential danger to road users and pedestrians should the ironwork fail.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102-104, Clapham High Street, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover rocking, 6th September
item.description:
The manhole cover I reported a bit over a month ago is unfortunately still rocking very loudly when vehicles drive over it, and keeps us awake at night. I know that the report was closed as it being fixed, but there may be then be a different cover that is also lose and needs to be fixed. The workmen should be able to hear it if they stand outside for some minutes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 525, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Banded Vechile, 6th September
item.description:
White transit van has been abandoned on public road behind our back garden gates. since July ,had not moved at all and recently have heard the doors been opened very early Iin the morning and late at night. Have seen a person coining from the van. This vechijw has to be removed , it’s untaxed and has no MOT.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nuthatch Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 6th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Terrace, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: Two black bags thrown to the middle of the street, 6th September
item.description:
Someone threw two bags during the night in middle of Page Heath Lane. Both have what seems to be plants inside. During the morning someone put the bags out of the street and place them close to our property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London

item.title: Alarm going of for over 4 hours, 5th September
item.description:
Not sure where it is but on the gayhurst blocks there is a smoke or fire alarm going of for over 4 hours could even be more I’m not sure if it’s in someone’s house or one of the many empty houses on the block if you stand outside doorway 39 to 42 you can hear it and also if you stand on the grass that is in the middle of the 4 blocks , can’t see any smoke or fire This can continue all night please could someone look into this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hopwood Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
